medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain, nausea, and vomiting for 4 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced intermittent RUQ pain for an unspecified duration, which worsened over the past 4 days. The pain typically occurs a few hours after meals and may migrate to the back or shoot into the chest. The patient also reported night sweats, chills, and diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anxiety; septoplasty x2; neck surgery as a child; left carotid body tumor resection.
medical_history.family_history: Aunt with gallbladder problem, father has prostate cancer, grandmother with diabetes mellitus and coronary artery disease.
